channel.title: Best language to make rs window thing
channel.description:
I was going to make something for rs like swift switch and i was wondering what the best language to code it in would be.
and also i was wondering if you could make it so that you cuold run a scar script independ from the scar compiler

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

http://www.google.ca/search?hl=en&q=c%2B%2B+compiler&meta=

Read full topic
item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

nade:

Uhm Yeah you do, you can open it in ollydbg and tell that it was compiled in MSVC++.

Because of course, MSVC++ is the only C++ compiler.

This still dosen’t change the fact there are no C++ “decompilers” either. (I know of at least one, but have you seen the code it generates? It’s far far from the original code, it looks like a monkey wrote it with half a keyboard.)

Read full topic
item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

What the fuck are you nubs on. You can’t fully decompile a visual basic 6 application, only about like 35% with shitty software such as semivbdecomp (which I happen to have the sourcecode to). As for .NET, the code is fully recoverable.

I like how people love to share their knowledge in order to win an argument. Yet they seem to have no understanding of anything.

“all languages are without a packer”

Do you like have no basic understanding of pe? Like none at all?

“you don’t even know if the code was written in C++ at all”

Uhm Yeah you do, you can open it in ollydbg and tell that it was compiled in MSVC++.

Read full topic
item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

well

the way he put it, he said u could take a .net program and turn it into .vb files (i guess thats what he meant) but I gave him the benefit of the doubt and thought he meant reverse (as in reverse engineering using ollydbg or other program)

annnnddd u can tell what a program was made with (usually) by using peid (i think its peid) which looks at a part of an exe (some compilers put the compiler name in the exe at the top of an exe)

Read full topic
item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

All languages can be decompiled? I guess that’s how you define decompilation. You can’t exactly “decompile” a C++ program in the same way we do with Java - you don’t even know if the code was written in C++ at all. Decompilation really only works well with language that compile to a bytecode.

Read full topic
item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

hahahaha u better go with .net

its taking over!!! even my fucking gfx drivers require .NET (its a nice control center except one of the skins the OK button doesnt show up :/)

vb6 and .NET are about the same in speed for the most part

and decompile .NET?! WTF ARE U SMOKING?! You can decompile vb6 easier then .NET, not that .NET isnt easy as fuck, all languages are without a packer

opens ollydbg

Read full topic

item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

nade:

There are a lot of languages that need runtimes/frameworks. What’s your point?

My point was that .net is not worse than any of them just because it happens to be developed by MS. Especially when we are talking about a non speed critical program and you recommended VB in the same post that you bashed .net’s performance in. (Because we all know, VB6 is a speed demon!)

There are a lot of computer that don't have .net framework just like 15 years ago they didn't have vb6 runtimes and when you get a virus it would be like "Can't execute, go find dlls"

This is true, however a lot of applications require .net now, chances are most people on a Windows machine have got it, or are prepared to get it. On Linux there’s always Mono, and I don’t think many people on Linux are going to be running swiftswitch clones anyway.

Ollie:

LMFAO dont tell Mopman what todo

Damn straight! (But really, am I THAT bad??)

EDIT: Oh yeah, and the .net runtimes are 22mb, which is a lot less than 400. As you said yourself “if you don’t know what you are talking about, don’t say anything”.

Read full topic
item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Glory_4_Java Glory 4 Java
item.description:
@Glory_4_Java wrote:

wait you guys confused me now…so i shouldnt use vb.net? then what is good besides it.

i was pretty set on using vb but if another person cant run it unless they have vb installed then i guess i wont.

im kindof a begniner to C++ but should i try it anyway?

Read full topic
item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“nade, post:16, topic:105648”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=151343.msg1435902#msg1435902 date=1181047441]

Don’t use .net. .Net is for nubs. If you code something using the .net framework your application will run really slow. Most importantly nobody can run your applications unless they download the 400mb framework (it is probably shipped with every pc now). Here is the worst part: everyone can decompile your software easily - you are forced to obfuscate code which in the long run probably slows it down even more.

Just stick to c++ and vb, there is something better though that came out not a while ago: d.

http://www.dprogramming.com/

“Don’t use Java. Java is for nubs. If you code something using the Java framework your application will run really slow. Most importantly nobody can run your applications unless they download the framework. Here is the worst part: everyone can decompile your software easily - and you are forced to obfuscate code which in the long run probably slows it down even more.”

(aka: You were very wrong on most points)
[/quote]

If you don’t know what you are talking about then don’t say anything.

There are a lot of languages that need runtimes/frameworks. What’s your point?
There are a lot of computer that don’t have .net framework just like 15 years ago they didn’t have vb6 runtimes and when you get a virus it would be like “Can’t execute, go find dlls”[/quote]
LMFAO dont tell Mopman what todo

Read full topic

item.source: Best language to make rs window thing

item.title: Best language to make rs window thing
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:7, topic:105648”][quote author=Glory 4 Java link=topic=151343.msg1431218#msg1431218 date=1180974659]
what is an assembler? it sounds nice and easy
[/quote]
its the hardest thing to code in besides having to code IRL on paper

actually called assembly

its wat every language is compiled into
its also known as machine code but I could be wrong on that part[/quote]

Nah, nothing is “compiled into assembly” and assembly is not machine code.

Assembly is a slightly simpler representation of machine code, it gives opcodes a name and simplifies assignment and stuff so nobody has to work with long strings of binary.

Read full topic
